intro: Silene polytricoides, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves that are often hairy, giving it its common name. Silene polytricoides is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. It typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and open woodlands.
